p: The Iranian Ministry of Health and Medical Education (MOHME) compiled the WHO guidelines for COVID-19 prevention and announced them through different platforms. Hotlines to answer questions and give advice on nutrition and mental health were available. National campaigns for increasing awareness and information were held to improve public knowledge. A website was launched ( salamat.gov.ir) to help people and answer their questions [ 48]. The political situation in Iran impacted the economic infrastructure, which indirectly affected the health sector and the first-line defense against the virus. Thus, the burden scaled up. In addition, the weakness of the medical infrastructure, inadequate personal protective equipment and difficulties in importing them are all key factors. Quarantining cities was rather ineffective due to viral distribution throughout the country [ 49].
